p: Between early and late sampling, microbial community composition in all treatments became more negative along PC axis 1 (Fig. 3; ANOSIM statistic = 0.21, P = 0.01). Early in the season, AC made microbial communities similar to native soil. This was due to decreases in an unidentified bacteria and an Actinomycetales, and increases in aMicrococcaceae, a Pseudomonas and a Flavobacterium species (Fig. 2, ANOSIM statistic = 0.21, P = 0.01). Late in the season, native soils were distinguished from 0 and 1000 soils by an increase in the unidentified bacteria and Actinomycetales and a decrease in Flavobacterium.
